title: Registration & morning Coffee
description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with tech edicts around

title: Lunch
description: Foooooooood!

title: Coffee break
description: Coffeeeeeee!

title: Morning coffee
description: Coffeeeeeee!

title: Material Design on Custom Views
description:
There are various widgets to create user interfaces in Android Framework. Using these widgets is a starting point but they are not enough to create awesome apps. Fortunately, alternative methods are here to rescue! I mean understanding and extending the View class.

In this presentation, I will give some Custom View examples. Some of them makes impossible things be possible and some of them increase performance.

I will also talk about how to apply Material Design in Custom Views with the support of older platform versions.

title: #PERFMATTERS for Android
description: The slogan '#PERFMATTERS' by Colt McAnlis is one of the most important statements, which an Android developer should follow. A well performing application makes the difference between a nice looking application and one, which gets successful. You, as an Android developer, have the responsibility to delight your users, so they don't feel how much work your application has to burden to fulfill the user's needs. This session will show you some easy optimizations and how to avoid glitches in the application. A lot of developers would shout, that this is premature optimization. In contrary it is preventive. With a small amount of work while developing you can avoid a lot of pitfalls. You will hopefully have a better understanding of the underlying system afterwards. During the session some tools and frameworks will be presented for helping you to fulfill your mission.

title: JSF with PrimeFaces, from Ugly Duckling to a Beautiful Swan
description:
JSF has come a long way since its initial release and managed to catch up with modern web development model. Combined with the popular PrimeFaces framework, JSF unleashes its true potential.

This session takes you on a tour of modern component based java development with server rendering featuring rich set of components, responsive design, powerful Ajax APIs, a real-time push framework with websockets, a mobile web renderkit, the dialog framework, extensive client-side validation and attractive page layouts.

title: Piracy on Android
description:
Building awesome Android apps is a really really hard work that takes tons of time and dedication and also money. The worst thing that can happen to developers is that their apps get pirated and the developers that worked so hard to create them do not get honored for their hard work.

This talk will show the problems that arise from pirated apps as well as which countermeasures you, as a developer, can take to make it as difficult as possible to pirate your apps.

title: Infinite Scalable Systems with Docker, Docker Swarm, Docker Machine
description: In this session, I will mention about Containerization technology hsitory a bit and dive into Infinite Scalable Systems with Docker, Docker Swarm, and Docker Machine with a fully working demo.  There will be sweet docker commands and configurations to setup total scalable system in 10 minutes.

title: Design Patterns with Angular 2
description: The main aim of this session is to talk about the most useful design patterns and technical issues in Angular 2. This session can also content some of the new attitudes like reactive programming and etc.

title: The revolution of Material Design
description:
With the coming of Material Design in Android, how to imagine an application has changed completely. By following a few rules you can create applications with the best user experience and satisfaction.

The term Visual Continuity leads us to think of applications with visual changes no longer immediate and sudden, but handled naturally as material things. A few head movements and animations focused to ensure visual continuity that every user wants.

title: Life of APK
description: This talk aims to explain all process that is happening behind, from creation to display an Android application.

title: Animation for Interfaces
description: While digital screens reduce our senses to only visual and listening, we can improve usersâ€™ experience and understanding through animations. I thought about how the whole team can develop animations without the knowledge of motion design. Create design and branding patterns for mobile and web with basic knowledge and tools and go strait into development.

title: Android Crash Reporting with Crashlytics
description: The session shows what Crashlytics (part of Twitter Fabric) can do to help you to find and fix problems in an Android App. Starting with a short introduction I will show how to get started with Crashlytics using Android Studio and what kind of information about problems/bugs are sent to the developer after the app has been deployed.

title: Dart - a language for your next project!
description:
Dart is a language by Google which is object oriented with optional types. You can use Dart to build great apps for the client-side, server-side, command line or for mobile.

Come to listen to my story why I love Dart, why it makes me productive and how you can use it to build your next project!

title: Optimizing Apps for Better Performance
description: Performance matters to users, so it must matter to you. In this session, I will talk about how to identify and fix performance bottlenecks and using profiling tools.

title: Event Driven Programming for Android
description: Event-Driven programming paradigm, still not widely used, where the flow of the company is determined by events such as user input, threads output or messages from components. An Event-Driven system can increase the modularity and testability of our application. In fact, the entire application is very easily decoupled, what offers a lot of benefits! Although there are a few libraries supporting event programming, Android does not natively provide us an architecture and the necessary components to implement this on a clean way. This talk will analyze the state of the art of Event-Driven programming in Android, analyze all its benefits and propose some architectures for its implementation.

title: Google WebRTC on Mobile
description: WebRTC is a new milestone in the evolution of the web. This technology allows us to quickly create real-time communication applications. Altough its main target is web browsers, WebRTC is becoming a popular real time communication technology used on mobile. By using WebRTC you can develop your own peer-to-peer video chat in a short amount of time. Also, WebRTC is very flexible, you can make calls to another networks that using offer/answer model, for example SIP protocol. In this presentation you can gain in-depth insights about how to implement WebRTC on iOS and Android mobile devices for a native experience.

title: Developing, testing and writing better Java and non-Java applications with the NetBeans IDE/Business of Software 101
description:
2 sessions for the price of 1!

A step by step guide to all the features NetBeans offers both Java and non-Java developers to create,edit, test and ship code (30 mins)

Business of Software 101 (10 minute essential guide to the software industry in 2015 and how to make the most of your strengths in it)

title: Developing Ideas in f2p Environment
description:
How to develop an idea into a game:
-Know your environment
-Stages and layers of games
-Value of failing
-Defining MVP
-Prototypes
-Usertesting
-Fake/Soft Launches

title: Releasing Your Unity Game: How to Turn it into a Product
description:
Okay, so youâ€™ve made your game. Now what? Although it might seem youâ€™ve completed 99% percent of your project, itâ€™s the last 1% that takes the most of your time. Have you added analytics to your game? Have you integrated sharing through any social networks? What about in-app purchases?

In this talk, I will cover the bits and pieces required to turn your game into a product, which include adding analytics, social integrations, in-app purchasing, localisation, data persistence and remote & local notifications to your Unity Engine powered game.

title: Android Brillo and Daily Life UX
description:
In this presentation we will talk about daily use of IoT devices and the Android based operating system Brillo.

We are in the early stages in the creation of Internet of Things. And the examples I will provide just a glimpse into what is possible when you combine sensors, actuators, and networked intelligence to create more fun and easy lifestyle.

title: Introduction to Google Project Tango and Intel RealSense technologies and usages
description:
RealSense and Tango are projects which objective is to bring complete motion and space understanding to apps, by using specific cameras integrated into devices.

You'll discover what are the different SDKs and cameras, how to use these that are becoming available to consumers really soon, and see what amazing products and new usages other developers have already started to work on.

title: Deploying and managing container-based applications with OpenStack and Kubernetes
description:
Linux containers have recently taken the industry by storm, offering a lightweight, powerful, portable and upgradeable alternative to traditional app deployment on a host OS/VM.

Managing Docker containers on OpenStack VMs is possible today with Mirantis OpenStack, with the Murano Application Catalog radically simplifying the job of placing multiple application containers in an environment, installing apps in them from public resources such as Docker Hub, and deploying the environment on VMs for use. For managing containers at large scales, Mirantis and Google are now working jointly to enable Murano to configure and deploy Kubernetes â€” the Google-initiated open source project to build and refine cluster orchestration for containers on infrastructure.

In this presentation the core concepts of OpenStack, Docker and Kubernetes will be described, as well as demonstrated abilities to deploy containerized applications, managed by Kubernetes on above of OpenStack cloud.
